definition: unpleasantly stormy, make soiled, filthy, or dirty
details:
adjective
- unpleasantly stormy
= example: unpleasantly stormy
- soiled or likely to soil with dirt or grime
= example: soiled or likely to soil with dirt or grime
= synonyms: soiled, unclean
- (of behavior or especially language) characterized by obscenity or indecency
= example: (of behavior or especially language) characterized by obscenity or indecency
- spreading pollution or contamination
= synonyms: contaminating
- unethical or dishonest
= example: unethical or dishonest
= synonyms: sordid
- violating accepted standards or rules
= example: violating accepted standards or rules
= synonyms: foul
- expressing or revealing hostility or dislike
= example: expressing or revealing hostility or dislike
- obtained illegally or by improper means
= example: obtained illegally or by improper means
= synonyms: ill-gotten
- a manuscript defaced with changes
= example: a manuscript defaced with changes
= synonyms: foul
- vile
= synonyms: filthy, lousy
- of color, discolored by impurities
= example: of color, discolored by impurities
= synonyms: dingy, muddy, muddied
- contaminated with infecting organisms
= example: contaminated with infecting organisms
= synonyms: pestiferous
verb
- make soiled, filthy, or dirty
= synonyms: soil, grime, begrime, colly, bemire
